#Text=Find a Contractor
#Text=Even the handiest of homeowners need assistance with renovations occasionally .
#Text=From new construction to tear downs , help from an expert may be needed to ensure the job gets completed correctly .
#Text=Before calling the first name you come across in your phone book or on the Internet , consider the following advice when trying to find a contractor .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Seek advice from family and friends .
#Text=Ask people you know and trust for a recommendation if they have had similar work done in their homes .
#Text=You will feel more confident in calling a contractor who has made your best friend or brother happy with the renovation .
#Text=Consult with professionals you already know .
#Text=If you have a great electrician or plumber , he has experience with reliable contractors and will not hesitate to provide you with names and numbers .
#Text=Your professional will not recommend someone he would n't use .
#Text=Collect more than one contractor estimate .
#Text=Make sure that you have at least 3 contractors bid on your home renovation project rather than hiring the first one that walks through your front door .
#Text=When you sit down to compare , the work that was quoted by each contractor should be similar in its specifications .
#Text=Examine business cards .
#Text=A contractor should provide a business card when meeting you , and that card needs to have a physical address , telephone number and a license number .
#Text=Once she leaves , verify the information and the status of her license .
#Text=Check references .
#Text=A decent contractor will not hesitate to provide a written list of references , and the longer the list , the more likely he is reputable .
#Text=Call as many on the list until you have the information you need .
#Text=A tip to ensure quality is to skip around the list instead of going in the order provided .
#Text=Verify insurance information .
#Text=When you are meeting with a prospective contractor , ask her to show you an insurance certificate .
#Text=In the alternative , you can request the contractor 's insurance carrier and telephone number so that you can be sure the policy is in good standing .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Beware of cash .
#Text=When you find a contractor that you like , ask how he expects to be paid .
#Text=The one who wants all cash may be cutting corners that will also cut the quality of the job done in your home .
#Text=Drop a contractor without a cell phone .
#Text=Almost every professional has a cell phone , so if you find a contractor without one , do not hire her .
#Text=A contractor should provide you with means to reach her easily .
#Text=Question the contractor who eliminates the permit .
#Text=If your renovation project is substantial , you will most likely need a construction permit .
#Text=If the contractor suggests skipping this paperwork , it could mean that he is n't licensed or does n't want to be monitored .
